alert.note: Alert for McCreary (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McCreary County through 545 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Great Meadows Campsites, or 12 miles northwest of Oneida, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern McCreary County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
